what: Turns Data into Short Form Commentary for RMarkdown
title: Turns Data into Short Form Commentary for RMarkdown
text: purpose package create package functions assist writing small sections automated commentary inside RMarkdown documents, particularly creating descriptions data. functions code designed work project, general functions use wide range people.

title: Turns Data into Short Form Commentary for RMarkdown
text: package can installed directly Github using remotes install_github call

title: Turns Data into Short Form Commentary for RMarkdown
text: package three different functions operate way, designed accept slightly different numeric data types represent changes data. : percent_change: percentage changes pp_change: percentage point changes number_change: numeric change three accept numeric value vector, return short string commentary based value numeric. Negative values accompanied “” word (decrease//etc) positive values accompanied “” word (increase//etc). Small changes (less 1% 1pp, 100 numeric) recorded stable word (little change/etc.) can choose descriptor words like use making use description argument associated code. default, set . see full list descriptor options codes, use show_descriptions() function. Additional arguments three functions include: percent_change: ... additional arguments passed scales::percent function. pp_change: abbr indicate whether ’d like changes recorded “percentage points” “pp”. functions: unchanged_limit set limit either direction constitutes “change”. ### Top values dataset package also two different functions designed describe top n number values dataset (containing values names values), function returning slightly different description based data. top_x: returns string names top “n” values, grammatically correct way. provide warning equal values outside top n values. .e. return “north, south east” n = 3. top_x_percent: returns string names top “n” values, alongside percentage total values provided. .e. return “north, south east (20% total)” “north, south east (10%, 5% 2% total respectively)” n = 3. Arguments functions include: n: number values report commentary (e.g. n = 3 return commentary discussing top 3 values) values: column name column containing numerical values sort top n values . names: column name column containing name values used describe top n values. top_x_percent : sum_percentage want single percentage total returned n number values, individual percentage value?

title: Format a date into a consistent human-readable format — date_name
text: x date date format. abbr_day logical. Whether like name day week abbreviated. Defaults TRUE. abbr_month logical. Whether like name month abbreviated. Defaults TRUE. include_year logical. Whether like date include year. Defaults FALSE.
